transcription: 'speaker_B': 'So, why did I call you all here?'
'speaker_B': 'Um, what I'd like to talk about is, um the transcription.'
'speaker_B': 'So, as part of this um project, we need to transcribe these meetings.'
'speaker_B': 'um, to do training and test and so on.'
'speaker_B': 'and, uh, so we need word transcripts and, uh, speaker change identification.'

'speaker_B': 'And, uh so I'd sort of like to know who's going to do that, hi Jane, and uh what tools to use, what other resources you might need, and also what we things like just the data format and'
'speaker_A': 'So, I'm just curious how how h'
'speaker_A': 'how exactly you got roped into this.'
'speaker_D': 'Um, because my name was was mentioned when I wasn't around, but I'm most happy.'
'speaker_D': 'but I think that I was uh proposed before I was asked?'
'speaker_D': 'And that doesn't matter cuz I think there was probably an a uh'
'speaker_A': 'That would be m That would be my fault.'
'speaker_D': 'y an indication that that I was interested in advance and, in which case, I thank you.'
'speaker_B': 'And so, one of the first questions is, do you need help?'
'speaker_C': 'Do you So, do you What are what are we talking about?'
'speaker_C': 'That you're gonna you're gonna do transcriptions?'
'speaker_C': 'You're going to listen to these things and'
'speaker_D': 'I'm going to provide I'm going to be once I'm given the data, I will provide w word level transcripts with uh indication of speakers, and'
'speaker_D': 'I guess speaker change in any case, so speaker ID,'
'speaker_A': 'So you're gonna do the actual transcription yourself.'
'speaker_C': 'D I And do you have a clear I mean, is that'
'speaker_C': 'Do you sort of Are you going to have to make up what you do or do you have a very'
'speaker_C': 'clear idea of what you're going to do?'
'speaker_C': 'So I mean, is it is it Is this l'
'speaker_C': 'Is it like something you've done before?'
'speaker_D': 'I mean, there are always ways of doing things more efficiently or more uh in a more technical technically sophisticated way?'
'speaker_D': 'Do you have to speak true English sentences when you do this?'
'speaker_C': 'Yeah, because as people are going to be listening to it afterwards and saying'
'speaker_C': 'She couldn't even speak true English sentences!'
'speaker_C': 'Oh, you're meant You're meant to speak naturally.'
'speaker_C': 'You're meant to say Oh, I didn't realize we were being recorded!'
'speaker_D': '" This microphone, what's this doing around my neck?'
'speaker_B': 'Uh, that's I I was saying before we don't really have to worry about people being surprised by it.'
'speaker_D': 'OK, so um typically, what I w you know I in uh'
'speaker_D': 'i what I've done before is I have a uh tape recorder, with a reverse button.'
'speaker_D': 'And you just, you know, if it's word level e you know, you do a e a r I just hit the r'
'speaker_D': 're the rewind button every couple of words and type what I know and then'
'speaker_D': 'and then at the end do a breeze through to be sure that everything's correct.'
'speaker_D': 'However, they do have software these days which with a digitized uh record you can have control over replay through some sort of an interface.'
'speaker_D': 'I know it would be an a wonderful idea.'
'speaker_D': 'It's just I haven't transcribed in in awhile.'
'speaker_C': 'The problem is The nice thing about transcribers is they have foot pedals,'
'speaker_D': 'um But I frankly didn't find it any more use to me than my hand held taperecorder.'
'speaker_D': 'However, if we have a transcribing machine I would accept it.'
'speaker_D': 'The other thing is, you know, having getting hold of a transcriber.'
'speaker_C': 'Well, Sarah has one because she does a lot of transcribing of interviews.'
'speaker_A': 'The other thing is is that we might be'
'speaker_C': 'The crazy thing is we'd have to convert the s we'd have to dump the audio files onto cassette.'
'speaker_C': 'I mean, given that we've already got them digitally it would be you know, it's quite tempting to use some kind of uh software thing.'
'speaker_C': 'But but then there's the question of the ergonomic interface, that'
'speaker_B': 'Oh, I actually have some foot pedals for theP C.'
'speaker_A': 'Well, that's what I was gonna say, is that Adam has foot pedals that we could probably try and rig something up to'
'speaker_C': 'now how how do you how do you decide which keystrokes they generate?'
'speaker_B': 'Um There's a little program that downloads into it.'
'speaker_B': 'But the program probably only runs in Windows, although I bet we could'

'speaker_B': 'So they're currently set up for Shift, Control, and Alt.'
'speaker_B': 'But I r I don't use them.'
'speaker_B': 'And so tha uh if that would help, uh I'm certainly willing to donate them.'

'speaker_D': 'Now, we're at a pilot phase right now, and what I was told is that beginning, you know, that the the pilot data would be something like half hour of uh or f you know half hour to forty minutes of running text.'
